content:
That's a great plan! Using the "Question" sticker in your Instagram Story is a fantastic way to encourage engagement and get feedback from your audience. By mentioning your YouTube channel and highlighting the success of your most popular video, you'll also pique their interest and build credibility.

Here's a sample Instagram Story idea to get you started:

**Instagram Story:**

**Slide 1:**
Hey friends! I'm excited to announce that I'm working on a new video series all about watercolor techniques! 

**Slide 2:**
But I need your help! I want to create content that you'll love, so I'd love to hear from you: Which watercolor techniques would you like to see covered in my series?

**Slide 3:**
Use the "Question" sticker below to share your suggestions! Whether it's wet-on-wet, glazing, or something else, let me know!

**Slide 4:**
And as a bonus, if you haven't already, be sure to check out my YouTube channel [Your Channel Name]! My most popular video, a watercolor painting tutorial, has already gotten 2,500 views!

**Slide 5:**
Thanks for your feedback, and I can't wait to create some amazing content for you!

**Question Sticker:**
What watercolor technique would you like to see covered in my series?

By using the "Question" sticker, you'll make it easy for your audience to provide feedback, and you'll be able to see the responses in your Instagram Story insights. You can then use this feedback to inform your content creation and ensure that your video series resonates with your audience.

Remember to keep your Instagram Story engaging, visually appealing, and concise. You can add more slides or use different graphics to make it more eye-catching. Good luck, and I hope you get some great feedback from your audience!
